description: Just simply amazing software. Author thank you very much for developing this!

My go-to tool whenever I need to merge or separate PDFs. I always forget its interface, but it's so intuitive I just CTRL+O, select my documents, then CTRL+S and save the result. Done in less than 30 seconds. Separating is also simple enough; you just click to select half the pages, delete them, save, undo and repeat for the other half.
Is light and work perfectly
Simple to use for simple tasks. No need for additional bells & whistles that are seldom used.
Perfect for my purposes

All the pdf manipulation features (except annotation) is there. You can organise your pdf the way you want it. But the UI is pretty slow (especially scrolling is super laggy), which makes the whole experience a little lackluster.

This app takes a long time to load files and seemingly doesn't close File Viewer while it does so. The result is that you get no visual indication of whether or not the file is opening, saving, or if the operation is going to work at all. If you have the patience to wait, it does seem like things eventually work out. Unfortunately, it was too much of an impedance for me to keep using it.
summary: Slow, frequently crashes, but able to do the job

description: Just what gnome needed! Don't have to do online tools anymore.
simple but powerful
One of the best application for editing PDFs.
first used a lot of memory and CPU than crashed. I admit, it was a big PDF
The open dialog/file selector didn't function, making the program unusable.
summary: The open dialog/file selector didn't function

description: Used PDf24 on windows, finally found the solution on Ubuntu to simply merge and rearrange documents!
Is really easy to use and useful
summary: Did what i needed it to do

description:
While intended for just rearrangement and merging, this can zoom in enough to read PDF. Merge, split, rearrange, and unlock PDFs. Autofinds page join for scans/printed-to-PDF 2page spreads to convert them to individual pages. Smooth.
I discovered that it will politely ignore that the source files are "locked" by Adobe.
This application is verry usefull, simple and lightweight
I made some arrangement to application, it keep saying "Only pages can be inserted"
Dead simple. It allows you to combine, rearrange, rotate, crop (and more) PDF files as easily as pieces of paper. Tiny learning curve. Love it!
It does exactly what it is meant to do, with no problem.
Whenever I try to save a file after arranging it the app fails and posts "only pages can be inserted"
I reverted to the older version of the app as the new one displays "only pages can be inserted"
Does not work. Everytime I try to save a file it says "only pages can be inserted".
Error message on save "only pages can be inserted".

See this link: 
https://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=2461328
I installed the recommenden ppa and PDFArranger works again as it did before.
This simple but power tool.

TRY

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:linuxuprising/apps
sudo apt update
sudo apt install pdfarranger
summary: Ubuntu 21.04 version broke old app version

description: Saving doesn't work. You need to install it from source to get the fix.
summary: No longer works, need to install from source

description: A light and responsive program that works very well.
does not save changes

The version from ubuntu base not working but with the repository 

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:linuxuprising/apps

The new is OK
Same as Swen George's review, attempting to export pages tells me you can only insert pages.
install from source or flatpak. Otherwise you can't save.
summary: works great besides the bug in the old ubuntu version

description: it says only pages can be inserted while saving and does not asve

Not working on KUBUNTU 21.04
error: "only pages can be inserted"
I'm getting a persistent "only pages can be inserted" error when trying to save. Used to be my go-to for simple PDF manipulations, but it now needs an update. Kubuntu 21.04.
Gives a "Broken pipe" error when you try to save a document.

I use this tool almost everyday dealing with pdf files. It has never let me down. 
Thank you to the devs
Does not work on latest LUbuntu 64bit, states you can only edit pages when trying to save.
Getting the newer version from flathub (1.7+) resolves the "only pages can be inserted" issue. Soo thankful this exists to workaround a workflow I'm used to doing in macos's preview.app

Does all the basic pdf page order edits.
Great Applications..does what it says..however needs a bit of performance upgrades

might as well have a viewer that only shows thumbnails. about as useful. can't save/ export or output anything so no use at all.

Opened OK for me in Kubuntu 21.04 and seemed to be working. Got an error message saying it had stopped working but it was working OK.

This is too useful a piece of software to be left in this dodgy state.
Very simple and easy to use

Running on Fedora 35. I like how simple the UI is and how fast everything works. I also have Windows on my machine (dual boot) and Acrobat is so incredibly slow at rearranging PDF pages it's ridiculous; unlike Acrobat, this tool works quite well!
summary: Simple and easy to use, no crashes

description: This does everything I need it to do, works consistently, looks great, and is written with GTK which provides integration with Gnome.
summary: Great App! Functional and logical workflow!

description: I get only pages can be inserted wich after looking arround has been an issue for some time now. droping this program
One of the few things I miss from OSX is 'preview's impressive ability to rearrange PDFs. This does that intuitively and a lot more. I am a fan.
Just merged a research paper PDF with its supplementary PDF. Voila the links contained in the text jumping to the references did not work anymore after merging. This is quite lousy!

Just load PDF pages and drag them around. I have almost 60 pages and haven't notices any slowdown.

It is a little confusing that the project file is a PDF just like the page files loaded into it.
Simple and intuitive to use, for messing around with PDFs. A lifesaver at times. Has worked great for me on all *buntu distros.

Running Ubuntu 21.04 and I get "only pages can be inserted" too. 

Looks nice but doesn't work for me.
very useful thank you!

I've been using PDF Arranger to work with scans to merge PDFs and rotate them and it does that great, although some UI choices are a bit weird like the 50 ways to export.
I wish there was a way to group pages in the App to export multiple PDFs at the end.
Very much needed on Linux and always improving!! Great work devs
It is the best pdf tools in Linux, I have installed in on Kubuntu 22.04 and it's running perfecto
Actually gets the work done

Installed on Debian 11. To Submit One PDF report to My Bank, out of very different Sized, Shaped, Rastored, Vectored, Texted PDFs from my old resources, I created a New single PDF. I can change position of the Pages by easy drag & drop. Responded very Fast without any quality impact.
summary: Marvellous PDF Creator & Editor from Old PDFs

description: Can split pages within a leaf (2 pages scan for instance), AND can split the document (cut at page N).
summary: Finally one PDF Editor that works fine

description: Simple, intuitive UI. I use it all the time to combine, shuffle, extract PDF files. Drag and drop just like rearranging printed pages.
summary: Simple PDF arranger, just like the name says

description: It does what it should. without any complexity. Love it!
Works great, does not crash
I have to say that this app is really awesome and convenient to use. It helped me in a lot of situations where I needed to edit pdfs.
Works without issues on XUbuntu 22.04
The App makes combining and rearranging PDFs very easy and fast. There are also handy additional features, such as page rotation and white margin trimming.
Intiutive and effective. Works great for extracting, deleting and arranging pages.

Allows multi-page viewing, etc. Flatpak version, 24/9/22.
Seems better than offerings on Windows opreating system.
Yup, what it says in the title.
summary: Remove white spaces from all pages is the best feature

description: I always come back to this one to shuffle, join and remove pages from PDF files to a single result
Works well and fast. Easy to find desired options / tools.
I find it updating everyday, don't know why.
Does what it does, effectively. UI very intuitive. Haven't used it on huge files, but so far up to about 30 pages it's the cat's meow.
wanted to be able to rotate the documents incrementally via angle
Easy usem effective in dealing with pdf
Simple and works okay.
summary: Does what it says on the tin

description: ...but it does it better, faster, easier, cheaper, and thus a whole lot better and an absolute joy to use. thanks so much!
Does the basic tasks, simply and effectively. Great work, Dev!

This has been a very useful tool.
 I often want to print partial sections of pdf's and this is great for making booklets out of the sections.
Rearange, combine pages of a different document, or remove pages; this does the basics.
You can't rotate or adjust page sizes or adjust any printing preferences.
I like this program because I can take a booklet sized pdf and use it to make other booklets using excerpts from it.
All the pages have to be the same size.
Word or libra odt files won't work. just ...pdf's
If you need a simple program to arrange, add, remove, make a booklet, then this is a perfect program.
I used to use pdfSam, but it crashed with higher versions of java. This one is much simpler than pdfSam - maybe more basic but much easier to use (also does not crash)
Excellent for quickly and easily editing pdf files!
I have been using it for years. Exactly what I needed. Not sure why people complain.
I needed to merger the first page of 12 documents and I was able to do it very easly just dragging and dropping the pages. Highly recommended!
Performa all mentioned tasks beautiflly! Lightweight and no bloat.
Needed a tool to split my pdf pages, and it did exactly that!

I regularly extract and merge pdf files. I have tried several applications in the past and have not been totally happy with how they worked. They often behave unpredictably, unreliably, or are downright faulty.

So far I have been very happy with PDF Arranger. It took me about 5 seconds to understand how it works, and the results were exactly as expected. If you, like myself, are striving for the still elusive paperless office, I highly recommend this application!
summary: Works very well, and what's more, as expected!

description:
Simple interface, Easy to Use and does the job! 
Very handy tool, if you're dealing with a lot PDF copies on day to day basis.
Only took a star because it's snap version doesn't open on my computer, while .deb is flawless. The program is great. Thanks
Does one thing -- well, half a dozen things -- well, without fuss, and with an easily graspable UI. I use it frequently.
It would be good if there will be an option for auto page number for combined PDFs (without existing page numbers themselves).
just works. Open the software, drag and drop your pdf, rearrange the pages and save. Great stuff :D

Easy and intuitive for generic PDF rearranging/merging.
But if you print from it you don't get what you'd expect, better use another program (Evince for example)
summary: Good for PDF shuffling/merging, not for printing

description:
I use it a lot. It works just fine.

Arch Linux on Wayland. Flatpak package.

Macht genau das was es soll: PDFs zusammenfügen und Seiten verschieben oder entfernen. Und das so simpel wie es irgendwie geht!

Unter KDE empiehlt es sich das upspring ppa einzubinden, dann hat man die aktuelle 1.7.1 Version auch als deb installiert.

Das ist mit weitem Abstand das beste Tool unter Linux, um einzelne PDF-Dateien/ -Seiten zusammenzufügen, zu drehen, umzuorganisieren, zu löschen usw. Unter Windows gibts nichts vergleichbares für lau...

summary: Mit Abstand bestes PDF-Tool unter Linux

description: By far the best tool for PDF editing on Linux and within Gnome. It has many features, is very stable and userfriendly. The only feature I miss, is the ability to set a password protection.

description: Tut was es soll. Das zuschneiden ist im Seitenformat versteckt.

For general purpose completely enough, it has an easy to use interface and allows easy combining, rotating, duplicating of sites and more. 

Editing sites only works for a single PDF file, combining happens afterwards in a second step. A lot of functions are in the "right-click menu"
Nice replacement for PDFmod and PDFshuffler, works fine under Leap 15.4 and Tumbleweed.
1a, einfache Bedienung und schnell, zu empfehlne bevor man sich mit anderen halbferigen Apps viel Zeit verliert.
Funktioniert hier wunderbar. Macht genau das was es soll.
Ist eigentlich recht gut, man hat aber keine Möglichkeit, Text hinnzuzufügen und ist nur dafür zu benutzen Ränder abzuschneiden oder PDFs zusammenzuführen.
Sehr hilfreiches Tool, wenn man PDF-Dateien umorganisieren muss, Teile entfernen, oder neue Seiten hinzufügen möchte. Dieses Tool ist bei mir häufig im Einsatz. Mein Danke an den/die Entwickler!
Funktioniert perfekt, einfache Bedienung. Ich wollte schnell mal ein paar Seiten drehen.
Einer der besten PDF Creator den ich seit langem hatte, funktioniert einfach, schnell und kostet nix. Absolute Empfehlung!
